p: The research group of Shi, synthesized a number of thiazolyl-chalcones (E)-1-(4-methyl-2-arylaminothiazol-5-yl)-3-arylprop-2-en-1-ones and assessed activity of these compounds against different cancer cell lines BGC-823, PC-3, NCI-H460, BEL-7402 by MTT assay. Some compounds indicated activity on cancer cells with IC 50 value below 10 µM. According to the in vivo test against S180 xenograft in mice, compounds 76a and 76b showed moderate activity that inhibited tumor weight 22-25%. Based on results, compound 76b indicated good anticancer activity, in vitro and in vivo. Presence of thiazole groups into chalcones can improve anticancer activity of them (Fig. 16) [ 91].
